verses.verse: For the director.[b] A psalm of David.
Listen, O God, to my cry of lament; from the dreaded enemy preserve my life.
Protect me from the council of the wicked, from the band of those who do evil.
They sharpen their tongues[c] like swords, and they shoot forth their venomous words like arrows,
while they attack the innocent from ambush, shooting suddenly and without fear.
[d]They agree on their evil plan, and they resolve to lay snares, saying, “Who will see us?”
They plot evil schemes and devise shrewd plots; the thoughts of their hearts[e] are hidden.
[f]However, God will shoot his arrows at them,[g] and they will suddenly be struck down.
Their own tongues will bring them down, and all who see them will wag their heads.[h]
[i]Then everyone will be in awe, as they proclaim God’s mighty deeds and contemplate what he has done.[j]
